title: Petrified Forest National Park: History & Culture
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture             History & Culture        Member of Zuni dance troupe performing at the park NPS/Hallie Larsen   Â   More than 13,000 years of human history and culture are represented at Petrified Forest National Park. From prehistoric peoples to the Civilian Conservation Corps, from early explorers to Route 66 motorists, the park has many stories to tell.  Meet People that lived and worked in the Petrified Forest. Explore Places important to park history.See some of the objects preserved in the Museum Collections. Other National Park Service History & Culture websites: Discover History Archeology Program  Antiquities Act Vanishing Treasures Archeology for KidsLearning Center of the American Southwest
